title: E.ON offers smart meter installation service to wider market
lead: It is offering a range of options to other suppliers, including meter financing, consultancy and installation to drive a successful nationwide rollout

title: London-based bank backs renewable energy in Egypt with $4.2m loan
lead: It will finance the construction of a solar power plant, with a capacity of 6MW, at Dina Farms

title: UK to end support for fossil fuel energy projects abroad
lead: The government will end export finance, aid funding and trade promotion for new crude oil, natural gas and thermal coal projects, with ‘very limited exceptions’

title: How could a smart meter paired with a thermostat slash monthly energy bills?
lead: OVO Energy will connect smart meters with thermostats to offer customers energy saving advice through an app

title: Britishvolt to build £2.6bn gigaplant at former coal-fired power station in Blyth
lead: By 2027, the firm estimates the project will be producing 300,000 lithium-ion batteries a year

title: World’s richest 1% ‘create more than double the combined emissions of the poorest 50%’
lead: The richest 1% will need to reduce their current emissions by at least a factor of 30 to help the planet meet the 1.5°C goal of the Paris Agreement, according to a new report

title: EU proposes stricter regulations for sustainable development of batteries
lead: Batteries used in industry, automotive and electric vehicles must have restricted use of hazardous substances, minimum content of recycled materials and a low carbon footprint

title: US announces $128m for research into sustainable transport
lead: The funding will support bioenergy as well as hydrogen and fuel cell technologies

title: Nearly half a million US clean energy workers unemployed as COVID continues
lead: The 446,000 workers make up around 13% of the total clean energy workforce, according to a new analysis of federal unemployment filings

title: Global CO2 emissions ‘plunged by 7% in 2020 due to Covid-19 pandemic’
lead: The decline in global emissions was the largest on record, according to a new report
